What did you do? You're referring to acquiring that helmet, right? Did you borrow it from a fellow knight? Perhaps you took it from a museum. Care to elaborate?

10.17.18  3:45 am   10.15.18  12:48 pm it seems to me like the first step is to try and finish songvideos a little bit earlier than the deadlines, and then spend the extra time before release making, say, half a reality video

10.15.18  2:23 pm   10.13.18  6:18 am are humans also all the same one?

wait... is everything the same thing? kind of, yea... thanks

10.15.18  12:48 pm   10.14.18  5:11 pm ...by not doing the other things you plan on doing? That's my point, you've been prioritizing creating new songs/videos for a long while, and I don't see you stopping any time soon to do the other stuff you want to do. I guess I should ask this instead: Are you ever planning to take a short break from creating music to work on making reality videos any time soon (say, within the next 6 months)?
10.12.18  4:12 pm   10.11.18  9:18 pm   Well then freedom to what?

10.12.18  7:38 am   10.12.18  1:32 am isn't it sad how making all this crazy content only makes you temporarily happy? Like barely.

      You finish it on time and you think "it's good enough" (because you said in the past that to make a truly perfect song/video you would have to spend your whole life just touching up tiny details, and you don't have that kind of time)

      and then right after releasing your content you forget about it and move on to the next thing. I guess my question is: Do you really never stop for a second to appreciate what you've created?
10.11.18  9:18 pm   10.10.18  3:44 pm     Freedom from what?

9.27.18  9:22 am   9.26.18  9:14 am yeah, i actually totally understand what you're saying. That actually makes me feel a lot better about things. Thank you. Now, here's another thing, do you ever feel like something you're trying to do gets "lost in translation/adaption"? Example: I have this amazing short story. One of the best things I've written thus far. There's this playwright competition thing I'm doing for school (two actually). I had this great idea: "Hey, I'm going to turn that short story of mine into a stage play" So, I start writing. And ew. In my head the idea worked so well, but on paper it's just not good. It loses all the stuff that made the original so fucking good. It made me kinda resent the story and avoid working on the script but the deadline is rearing it's godawful head and I'm going to have to finish it even though i don't like it and it just isn't what I wish it was. Oh, another thing I hate ab out it. I'm expected to write a good play but they (the judges i guess) put so many restrictions on it.

9.26.18  9:14 am   9.25.18 9:21 am well when you put it that way i can't really think of a good answer but i sure would like to. i guess the only real consequence is that i just can't get behind some of the things i write. like they don't make me as proud as other things. how can i get the most pride and dumbness from something I'm writing?
